title: AdHocICS[1].doc
description: The Internet Connection Sharing (ICS) feature of MicrosoftÃ‚Â® WindowsÃ‚Â® XP allows you to share a single Internet connection with multiple computers. Built-in support for IEEE 802.11 wireless LANs (WLANs) allows you to create an ad hoc wireless network. These two features can be used together to share a wired Internet connection with the members of an ad hoc wireless network. This article describes how to quickly and easily use Windows XP to share a wired Internet connection with other WLAN computers.
